metadata.title: Digital Archaeology
metadata.subtitle: A Journey Through the History of Computing
metadata.author: Digital Archaeology Team
metadata.description: Experience the complete history of computation from the abacus (3000 BC) to modern superscalar processors. Every invention exists because of a problem that demanded it.

actIndex.title: The Dawn of Calculation
actIndex.summary: From Sumerian merchants to Babbage's vision: discover why humans needed to automate calculation.

actIndex.title: Electrification
actIndex.summary: Census crisis, world war, and the birth of programmable machines through electrical relays.

actIndex.title: The Electronic Giants
actIndex.summary: ENIAC, UNIVAC, and the vacuum tube era: electronic switching enables unprecedented speed.

actIndex.title: The Solid State Revolution
actIndex.summary: From Bell Labs to Silicon Valley: the transistor and integrated circuit change everything.

actIndex.title: The Chip
actIndex.summary: The birth of the microprocessor: putting an entire computer on a single chip.

actIndex.title: The 8-bit Era
actIndex.summary: 8080, Z80, 6502: the processors that launched the personal computer revolution.

actIndex.title: The 16-bit Era
actIndex.summary: Breaking the 64KB barrier: segmentation, hardware multiply, and the IBM PC.

actIndex.title: The 32-bit Era
actIndex.summary: Protected mode, paging, and flat 4GB addressing: the architecture that runs the world.

actIndex.title: The Pipeline
actIndex.summary: Five-stage pipelines, hazards, and forwarding: making every cycle count.

actIndex.title: Superscalar
actIndex.summary: Out-of-order execution, branch prediction, and modern CPU marvels.

actIndex.title: The Future of Computing
actIndex.summary: Chiplets, quantum computing, neuromorphic processors, TPUs, and RISC-V: the next chapter of computing awaits.
